name: 廖昭文
objective: The objective of this course is to develop not only reading skills, but also the ability to think critically. It focuses on strengthening reading comprehension and encourages critical reading skills. A variety of strategies will be presented to assist the student in improving vocabulary, comprehension, reading rate, and flexibility in reading.
schedule:
1.A Letter to God
2.A Man Who Had No Eyes
3.The Necklace
4.The Beggarwoman of Locarno
5.Frigga's Necklace
6.Three Strong Women
7.A Boy with His Hat over His Crotch
8.Mary
9.Just Lather, That’s All
10.Old Man at the Bridge
11.Fresh Air Will Kill You
12.Harrison Bergeron
scorePolicy:
a. Reading assignments, quizzes, discussion and presentation  30%
b. Midterm Exam  35%
c. Final Exam  35%
materials: Views and Values (3rd edition) by Kari Sayers, Harcourt College publishers, 2005.
